005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint.impl.DefaultExpectConstraint;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
010
011import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
012
013/**
014 * Represents a rule requiring a Metaschema assembly, field, or flag data
015 * instance to pass a Metapath-based test.
016 * <p>
017 * A custom message can be used to indicate what a test failure signifies.
018 */
019public interface IExpectConstraint extends IConfigurableMessageConstraint {
020  /**
021   * Get the test to use to validate selected nodes.
022   *
023   * @return the test metapath expression to use
024   */
025  @NonNull
026  String getTest();
027
028  @Override
029  default <T, R> R accept(IConstraintVisitor<T, R> visitor, T state) {
030    return visitor.visitExpectConstraint(this, state);
031  }
032
033  /**
034   * Create a new constraint builder.
035   *
036   * @return the builder
037   */
038  @NonNull
039  static Builder builder() {
040    return new Builder();
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Provides a builder pattern for constructing a new {@link IExpectConstraint}.
045   */
046  final class Builder
047      extends AbstractConfigurableMessageConstraintBuilder<Builder, IExpectConstraint> {
048    private String test;
049
050    private Builder() {
051      // disable construction
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * Use the provided test to validate selected nodes.
056     *
057     * @param test
058     *          the test metapath expression to use
059     * @return this builder
060     */
061    @NonNull
062    public Builder test(@NonNull String test) {
063      this.test = test;
064      return this;
065    }
066
067    @Override
068    protected Builder getThis() {
069      return this;
070    }
071
072    @Override
073    protected void validate() {
074      super.validate();
075
076      ObjectUtils.requireNonNull(getTest());
077    }
078
079    private String getTest() {
080      return test;
081    }
082
083    @Override
084    protected IExpectConstraint newInstance() {
085      return new DefaultExpectConstraint(
086          getId(),
087          getFormalName(),
088          getDescription(),
089          ObjectUtils.notNull(getSource()),
090          getLevel(),
091          getTarget(),
092          getProperties(),
093          ObjectUtils.requireNonNull(getTest()),
094          getMessage(),
095          getRemarks());
096    }
097  }
098}
